text:
A habit of forgetting things in toddlers puts them at risk of dropping out of high school, reveals a new study.

According to the researchers, pre-schoolers who score lower on a memory task are likely to score higher on a dropout risk scale at the age of 12.

The children who perform better on a memory-testing task during toddlerhood are more likely to perform better in school later on — and therefore more likely to stay in school, the findings showed. — IANS
title: Forgetful kids at risk of becoming school dropouts
